required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Trial for MicroPort's Firesorb BVS: FUTURE-III
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective Multicenter Single-arm Clinical Trial Assessing the Safety and Effectiveness of Firesorb Sirolimus Target Eluting Bioresorbable Vascular Scaffold for the Treatment of Coronary Artery Disease: FUTURE III

brief_summary.textblock: The FUTURE-III study is a confirmative clinical trial for Sirolimus Target Eluting Bioresorbable Vascular Scaffold (Firesorb) after the feasibility and safety of the device has been preliminary confirmed in a small-scale First-in-Man clinical trial.

detailed_description.textblock: This study is a prospective, multicenter, single-arm trial in patients with coronary artery disease caused by up to two de novo native coronary artery lesions in separate epicardial vessels. The goal is to evaluate the safety and effectiveness of Firesorb to support the approval of the Chinese Food and Drug Administration (CFDA) for this product.All subjects will undergo clinical follow-up at 1-month, 6-month, 1-year, 2-year, 3-year, 4-year and 5-year post-index procedure. A total of 1200 subjects will be recruited, including 96 with long lesion (the scaffold to be used with a length of 33mm or 38mm) and 215 in the experimantal group of FUTURE-II clinical trial.

primary_outcome.measure: The number and rate of Target Lesion Failure(TLF)
primary_outcome.description: Target Lesion Failure is defined as the composited endpoints of cardiac death,target vessel myocardial infarction and ischemia-driven target lesion revascularization.

secondary_outcome.measure: The number and rate of Acute Success-Device Success
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the start of index procedure to end of index procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Successful delivery and deployment of the assigned scaffold at the intended target lesion and successful withdrawal of the delivery system with attainment of final in-scaffold residual stenosis of less than 30% by visual.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At time of procedure up to 7 days in hospital
secondary_outcome.description: Achievement of final in-scaffold residual stenosis of less than 30% by visual estimation with successful delivery and deployment of at least one assigned scaffold at the intended target lesion and successful withdrawal of the delivery system for the target lesion without the occurrence of cardiac death, target vessel MI or repeat TLR.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 month,6 months,2 years,3 years,4 years and 5 years after index procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Target Lesion Failure is defined as the composited endpoints of cardiac death,target vessel myocardial infarction and ischemia-driven target lesion revascularization.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 month,6 months,1 year,2 years,3 years,4 years and 5 years after index procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Patient-oriented clinical composite endpoint is defined as all cause death, all myocardial infarction, and any revascularization.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 month,6 months,1 year,2 years,3 years,4 years and 5 years after index procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Cardiac death (CD): Any death due to proximate cardiac cause (e.g. MI, low-output failure, fatal arrhythmia), unwitnessed death and death of unknown cause, all procedure related deaths including those related to concomitant treatment. Non-cardiovascular death: Any death not covered by the above definitions, such as death caused by infection, malignancy, sepsis, pulmonary causes, accident, suicide or trauma.

secondary_outcome.measure: The number and rate of Myocardial Infarction (MI)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 month,6 months,1 year,2 years,3 years,4 years and 5 years after index procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Attributable to target vessel (TV-MI), Not attributable to target vessel (NTV-MI)

secondary_outcome.measure: The number and rate of Target Vessel Revascularization (TVR)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 month,6 months,1 year,2 years,3 years,4 years and 5 years after index procedure

secondary_outcome.measure: The number and rate of Target Lesion Revascularization (TLR)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 month,6 months,1 year,2 years,3 years,4 years and 5 years after index procedure

secondary_outcome.measure: The number and rate of Any Revascularization
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 month,6 months,1 year,2 years,3 years,4 years and 5 years after index procedure

secondary_outcome.measure: The number and rate of Scaffold Thrombosis (per ARC definition)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 month,6 months,1 year,2 years,3 years,4 years and 5 years after index procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Timing (acute, sub-acute, late and very late) Evidence (Definite and Probable) Timing (acute, sub-acute, late and very late) Evidence (Definite and Probable) Timing (acute, sub-acute, late and very late), Evidence (Definite and Probable)

arm_group.description: Single Arm Safety and Effectiveness Confirmatory Study of Firesorb BVS

intervention.description: Implantation of Sirolimus Target Eluting Bioresorbable Vascular Scaffold （Firesorb）
